text: Great food and service. My friend and I ordered the onion rings and homemade pretzel bites as appetizers. The onion rings were the best I've ever had; crispy & flavorful and not greasy. The pretzel bites were soft and fluffy and came with a beer cheese sauce and whole grain mustard dips. My friend ordered the polish dog and I ordered the spicy Banh Mi dog. Both came with hand cut fries and were super delicious. We added a few craft beers and all I can say is Wow! Chef Anthony Vidal is the Executive Chef and was formally the Corporate Executive Chef of Hash House a go go, so you know the food is going to be awesome. We will definitely be back again and bring friends.
This breakfast I had here was one of the best I have a had in a long time! The chorizo was off the chain good and the hospitality was amazing as well! A must eat!

Chef is great and awesome 
Cook the fried chicken wings in our way 
Very kind hearted 
Taste is amazing

Wow. 

What a fucking gem. Go here. 

Definitely top 3 french toast I've ever had. Chorizo fries were excellent. Smokey Robinson was good, but I'd try something else next time. 

Keep this place open, bring a friend, they'll thank you.

Wow so good! Apple maps took us to wrong spot but we drive around the parking lot and found it. So glad we did. The best Home made English muffin and strawberry jam ever. Made onsite. Not too sweet. Chorizo scrambler, waffles, and service!!! Looks like they have good beers on tap but didn't try them. I like the environment although seats are hard metal. Casual but clean and nice environment. Wife loved the green eggs and spam and she has never had spam before! Waffles with walnuts ! Yumm! 3 TVs with mix of sports and other stuff on. Six bar seats. No smoking. Very awesome very awesome.

Great place, great look inside and great food.  Chef Anthony has done it right.  I have been there twice now, once for the sausage and once for the angus burger.  Had the fries both times and they were perfect both times.  Support this neighborhood restaurant, you won't be disappointed.

Not far from the strip is a strip mall that looks like it's waiting for a wrecking ball.  The advantage is there is plenty of parking.  I took a lap looking for this place and eventually saw a beautiful new facade and there it was. The interior is also shiny and new.  Very comfortable. 
The service was outstanding.  The craft beer selection is better than many bars.  Excellent. 
Being a sausage place I ordered the Sausage platter.  All world class sausages.  In particular the Phillipino sausage was exceptional. The onion rings were great. 
They also have fresh made fries.  Plus chorizo fries and carnitas fries.  The burgers look great,  too. 

An excellent, reasonably priced gem.  I'll be back,  if nothing else to try the delicious sounding breakfasts.
This was a pleasant surprise.  Great menu with great food.  Very nice beer selection as well.  Amazing place with excellent customer service.  Friendly vibe.   Will definitely go back

Onion rings....OFF THE HOOK !!! Will definitely make this a reoccurring stop on our trips to Sin City !!!.....had the Mexicali Sausage and the house made chorizo was on SPOT !!!...Awesome service to top it off.
Found this little gem on Yelp while visiting Las Vegas. I'm telling you this place is a must when your in town. The sausage is on point and the service is great.

Do yourself a favor and come to Commercial Center...you will find the most pleasant waitress named Audi to take your unique sausage or other yummy food order. The service was a ten and the food was excellent. The Vibe here is fun and colorful, and good tunes playing.  Prices where reasonable.  Good for the whole Family.  I will be back.

We just drove into LV and into the shopping center to see if any new food places opened up. We live across the street at LVCC and don't like to go far for breakfast, lunch or dinner. 

We scored!!

Lucky for us, Sausagefest has opened their brick and mortar restaurant to all their food trucks. 

The center is a little run down, but don't let that scare you away. We love the food that we have discovered here. 

We ordered beer, just to quench our thirst as we arrived and the mgr or owner gave us onion rings in the house. Onion rings are made here with homemade batter. They were delicious and very light. I AM COMING BACK!! 

GREAT PLACE AND TASTY APPETIZER! 

We will be here again tonight and maybe tomorrow for breakfast. 

Eat sausage!!!!!


Follow up.....

We came back for dinner and it was wonderful!! Happy Hour! 

The chorizo fries are amazing. 

See you for breakfast!!

Jean-Carlo, was our top flight man , But biggest shout out goes to chef Anthony. We Tried the pesto flatbread, pulled pork fries, corn dog, Mexicali. Dog and Smokey Robinson ... towards our ending of the meal the chef came at us again with a banana bread in beer batter that just rocked, truly glad I was given this place for a tip, I am just saying my words don't make justice for such deliciousness. Come thru. Yelp it. It's only right.

Who needs a certain Michelin star Thai restaurant to make commercial center work? Not Saussagefest! I'm so happy they put in such a cute hip ( not to mention legitimate) restaurant in this complex! It's just what the hood needed. 

The ambiance is relaxed,  clean,  and fun. The menu is diverse,  offering something for every appetite.  Feeling healthy? Have a tasty looking salad. Just heading in for swing shift? Get your all day breakfast here.  And who doesn't like a little bit of sausage in them after visiting the Green Door? 

The fries and onion rings are house made.  The sausages are perfect size,  and the corn dog was perfectly battered!! 

Beer selection could use a mini boost,  but all in all there's variety. 

So don't be turned off by the surrounding complex.  After all,  commercial center is part of the Las Vegas charm.  Let's support real local businesses Vegas style with a hot dog and a swinger's party!

It's a sausage fest up in here. Literally. Tucked into Commercial Center not far from the Green Door, this hip gastropub-styled spot serves up about seven different types of sausages, including a vegetarian option and all-beef hot dogs, as well as all day breakfast. 

Menu has a little bit of everything but could use a bit more specialty dogs or maybe just more gourmet ingredients- the Mexicali dog (bacon wrapped, chorizo, tomato, onion, cheddar, mayo, mustard) was filling and had a good kick of spice to it, and I like that their buns are made in house, but I'd totally down something with fig jam, arugula, and/or goat cheese. Maybe I'm too bougie for this place but it was hard to decide what to order because nothing really spoke to me or sounded that great. I do want to come back for their bratwurst though!

Besides the dog, I also tried the wedge salad (hello freshness!) and was treated to their pretzel bite app by the staff, which is always appreciated. Everything is made to order, super fresh, and full of flavor, the menu just seems to need a bit of work to make this spot stand out from the many other gourmet and specialty hot dog options in town.
Was my first time there and the Smokey Robinson was soooo good!! Will definitely come back soon! Chill environment, clean restrooms, wi-fi, friendly waiters, great prices. 10/10 for me

Glad I found this hidden secret spot on Yelp, I was gonna go down the strip to get some burger but when I saw their burger, I had to come try it out!! 

Locating this place is a bit of a challenge since it's inside this huge parking lot and all the businesses seems to look the same. But this place is right next to the Thai Arawan restaurant and its facing the Stratosphere tower. 

I really love the inside of the restaurant, it looks nice and clean, plenty of seating around. They have 2 regular sized TV, one by the entrance and one by the counter. 

I ordered their The Fridge burger, it's so good, not too big and not too small, very nice and juicy. Their fries are fresh as well. I ended up ordered their bacon wrapped hot dog to go!!!!  They also have Happy Hour special from 4pm-7pm $1 off beer. I will come back again whenever I m in town!!
Great place. A lot of variety. First time I got the smoky Robinson, and Some chorizo fries. All the food had great taste. Staff is super friendly and helpful.
Excellent customer service and suggestions. I would highly recommend this restaurant for any occasion. The Homemade French toast is great with the Founders breakfast stout.

The quality and friendliness of the service will give you a good experience here, but the quality of the food, although generally pretty okay and priced very reasonably, may be inconsistent.

We stopped by for breakfast/lunch on a weekend. There was only one other party there when we arrived, so we were able to sit down without a wait.

The overall feel of the cafe is nice. The service is prompt and friendly. The metal plates they serve their food in feel a little odd. They are made from a very soft metal so my fork under ordinary pressure was able to make grooves in the surface. This generally isn't a good thing?

We had some Pretzel Bites (complimentary), Sausage Rolls, Green Eggs & Spam, the Breakfast Bowl with Spam, and Bread Pudding (complimentary). The pretzel bites tasted good, but felt quite oily. The Sausage Rolls, although fairly good, still lacked a little something in the flavor. Our breakfast dishes were adequate. And the complimentary Bread Pudding was also basically adequate. 

So overall, pretty okay-ish experience at a reasonable price.

Stopped here based on the 40some great reviews.  Had some spicy sausage bahn mi and it was great.  Kids had corn dogs and waffles which were both awesome.  Dessert waffle and bread pudding were a nice ending.  Good for an off the strip local place with lots of parking.

We found this because it was in my notifications as hot and new and it looked delicious and it so was. I got the bahi mi sausage sandwich and my boyfriend got the fridge burger and we both got onion rings because they coat theirs in panko breadcrumbs for a yummy extra crunch. The pice was great and the portions were large. I was full for most of the day. Will definitely be coming back for some more.
The sausages are better than other places around town. What a deliciously fully cooked hot kielbasa. I hope people give this place a shot. You can play 8ball or 9 ball afterwards next store!
Love this new sausage spot! Beers on tap and fusion sausage dishes. The breakfast is fresh and yummy.
The food was great and reasonably priced.  Breakfast for 2 was under $20. The guy working there was incredibly nice and helpful. Tons of parking.

We went there with a few couples. The food was wonderful!! Inside the restaurant, it was clean and modern looking. The kitchen was open so you could see them cooking. The menu is the bomb! Prices were great too! If you can get past the awkward location in the Commercial Center District, it is a great meal (and service) that will exceed your expectations.

This is definitely one of the best restaurants I have been to ever.  The waiter was very friendly and helpful.  The food came out fairly soon after ordered, but the quality of the food can't be underestimated.  Though they specialize in sausages, I would recommend the waffle.  They serve the waffle with or without whipped cream, and the syrup they serve is warm and extremely good.  I would recommend taking the time to pour syrup into the individual waffle pocket, because it makes it all that much better.  The bathrooms where clean as resteraunt bathrooms go.  The resteraunt made me welcome as I first stepped in.

Came across this gem one morning while looking for breakfast in the Vegas area. Apparently they started out as a food truck, grew to 5 food trucks, and now have a storefront. Let me tell you how glad I am that they decided to open a restaurant lol. We got there when they first opened and the place was empty. I absolutely adore the mural on their wall and the sign directly across that reads: EAT SAUSAGE. My kind of place. We sat down and the menu is short but boy does it stand out! I had a hard time choosing but ended up getting the beef hot link and onion rings, I forget what the actual name for that is, and my husband got the Green Eggs and Spam. The link was delicious - served with lots of grilled onions, a slice of bacon, and a yummy bbq on a toasted brioche type bun. And the onion rings were amazing as well - you can tell they take their time making those cuz they're perfection when it comes to onion rings. That Green Eggs and Spam gave me serious feelings - the pesto on the eggs y'all. Whooooo. I need a minute. *sigh* it was beyond good. And the goat cheese took me over the top. We don't live in the area so I'm going to HAVE to try to make this at home because it was that good. I'm not a fan of spam but hubs said it was delish. Next time we are in Vegas we will definitely be back at this place so we can order an array of dishes and take them all back to our hotel and see who can eat the most. Talk about satisfaction! 

P.S. THEY MAKE THEIR OWN STRAWBERRY PRESERVES, Y'ALL!!!!!!! ZHRDBDKSNDBHFK IT WAS SO FREAKIN GOOOOOD!!!!
Everything was incredible, the whole menu...no joke! Fantastic chef and staff as well. Go and plan on eating a lot!

Found this place looking on Yelp.  Not from Las Vegas and hate chain restaurants.  WOW!!  What a neat place with a great menu.  Homemade Chorizo and other specially made sausage flavors.  My son an I had the same dish recommended by our fantastic server Bianca.  The Chorizo Hash was simply amazing.  Cubed potatoes, smothered with the best Chorizo ever, along with a little shredded cheese a few sautéed onions and two eggs.  Also got a side of their special homemade Spicy Italian Sausage.  Holy cow this was some special breakfast.  I highly recommend. Although a little hard to find, its all newly decorated inside, super clean and wide open.  Definitely will eat here again before leaving town.  Great menu for everyone's taste.  Priced very reasonable and portions are generous.

I've been to Sauagefest three times now, and it just keeps getting better. The ambiance is great, the people are awesome, and the food definitely does not disappoint. I intend to work my way through the menu.
Great food and service, so glade I saw the yelp and tried this place my self. I will be back for sure.

Super delicious breakfast!! We had the green eggs and spam along with the sausage waffles OMG loved!! We will definitely be back! Don't let the location scare you off this is a true gem! Staff was also super friendly and service in general was awesome! Definitely recommend this joint 100%

I'm happy SausageFest opened in my neighborhood. Oliver has been a wizard in the food truck scene for quite a few years. With this project, he brings his talents to a brick and mortar location. I had the Chicago Dog and Sausage Bites...will be back for more sausage and beer.

Bahn Mi I had here might be the best I've ever had??

Also got roommates french toast which looked amazing. 

Service also excellent, I hope I can convince people to come here more often~

Places like this are why yelp is final. Get away from the strip but only about a mile away. And you don't have to pay $30 for a $10 meal. Sausage was fantastic. Fries were excellent. Staff is friendly. Wish I could come tomorrow again for my flight back to Florida.

Service was super great the waitress was a doll - it was empty when I went. However I ordered sausage rolls and never received them. Never realized till I left either. The hot dog was decent. 

Not really worth going back for. Fun for one time. 
$36 for two dogs, a beer, and pretzel bites that I didn't order.

We stumbled upon this place by complete accident, and I could not be happier that we did! We had a party of 7 and we each ordered a different item off of the menu. Every single thing was absolutely PHENOMENAL! Be sure to get the bread pudding for dessert, you will not be disappointed!

Was in Las Vegas for work and decided to venture away from the usual hot spots on the strip.  This place hit it out of the park!

The food here is bomb.com.  Everything is made from scratch and it is prepared fairly fast for those who don't want a long wait.  They have an array of hot dogs and sausages as the name may suggest but also have a bunch of all day breakfast and sandwiches to partake in.  There is a decent selection of bottled beer and wine for those looking to tie one off with dinner.  The price is a great point in that it's generally $10-15 a person for a meal that will fill you up.  

The only downside to this place would probably be the location.  It is hard to find inside the strip mall, in the middle, and the area is a little shady.  I've walked and driven there a couple times now just fine, however I would not walk around there after the sun goes down.  

The inside decor is kickass.  You can tell they put in a lot of thought to it and that it is a pretty new place.  The staff is very nice and helpful, very attentive wait staff but not annoying in that they are constantly asking things.  They just seem to know when you need something and they are there to provide.  

Bottom line:  I HIGHLY recommend trying this place out if you are in town and in the area.  You won't be disappointed.

I ordered the French toast- AMAZING! Also, best bacon I've ever had. Yeah it was that good. And absurdly low prices with more than generous portions. Friendly waitstaff. Hidden gem. In short, recommend without reservation.

The location of the restaurant was kind of questionable. Its located in an old area and looks abandoned. But don't get the location twisted with its menu. I ordered the Breakfast Bowl that came with the garlic fried rice and there sausage. The garlic fried rice was on point! It also came with some sort of pickled vinaigrette sauce that complimented there sausage.
This is a great little place. The hostess was very nice and makes sure you have everything you need. The service is great and the food even better. Make a point of checking this place out!
Wow, great place with great food and service!  A little "diamond in the rough" worth the visit.  Highly recommended!

Eight of us stayed at the Westgate hotel but they only gave us 4 complementary buffet tickets so 4 of us had to fend for ourselves. THANK GOD we had to otherwise we would not have found this hidden gem. This place is amazing. It's hidden in what used to be Korean town. Since it was our first time here they gave us their homemade pretzels with beer cheese (which is delicious) and mustard. 4 of us ordered the Chorizo hash, the house French toast, the S.E.C with the vegetarian Italian sausage substitute, and garlic fried rice with spam. I have a couple of things to say:
1 - the price is very reasonable. The chorizo hash would normally be 10$ up at any other diner and have subpar taste. The Chorizo Hash here is about 8$ and tastes gourmet. 
2 - the taste of everything is phenomenal. The French toast melted in your mouth, the fried rice was savory, the chorizo was pleasantly spicy, and the S.E.C tasted like a pizza (in a good way).
3 - the customer service is above excellent.

Great new place! Friendly, efficient staff, great food and service, and casual fun atmosphere. Each of our party of 4 had something different and we all agreed the flavors were wonderful. They bake their own brioche buns daily, and hand-cut fresh French fries, among other things. The pulled-pork fries and the "Fridge" burger were hits. Compliments to the chef and our waiter.

Whatever your dinner plans were for tonight--cancel them and go to Sausagefest! My family and I went there today for lunch and were blown away by how delicious the food was and how amazingly accommodating the staff was! I am vegan but everyone else in my family are carnivores,so trying to find dining options that everyone is happy with is pretty tough. Sausagefest covered all the bases, vegan options for me and meat options for everyone else! I ordered a vegan sausage with avacado and pico de Gallo with a side of fries and let me just tell you ...YUM! I will be back soon!

Don't miss out on the Happy Hour from 4pm-7pm! All burgers are $5 and hot dogs are 1/2 off around the same price. 

Although this place feels like a hole in the wall because it's located in a non-busy commercial center off of Sahara. Sausagefest has dim lighting for that bar feel they have going on. They have the beer taps, so all they're missing is TVs with sports channels.. 

I have a feeling this could get trendy. I already love the gourmet menu items they serve. A lot of it is sausage dishes inspired from different food cultures. Such as the Hawaiian Loco Moco, Longanisa Bahn Mi, Green eggs and Spam, to the Mexicali dogs. 

My group went for the Falafel Burger, Pork Pull Fries, Avocado and Egg Breakfast Platter, and the Mexicali hotdog. The portions are huge and filling that I ended up taking half my left overs to go lol.  worth the price. 

The server was fast and time efficient. She grabbed the drinks and fries out for us first while we wait for our orders to finish cooking. She even asked around our table for feedback. Too bad I didn't catch her name because she was great. 

Check out the pictures I uploaded and like my review!

On our last day in Las Vegas, my girlfriend looked up on yelped and found this restaurant called Sausagefest. I liked sausages, so i agreed to eat there. This place is located in a strip mall with plenty of parking. Inside, there are plenty of tables and a few televisions to watch games. There is a soda fountain, so you can get your own soda. The lady that took our order was super helpful in answering our questions about what type of sausages there are and what her recommendations are. Kudos to her!

My girlfriend and i ordered the Chorizo Fries which was very tasty. Surprisingly the chorizo wasn't overwhelming salty, and complimented the fries very well. It also had some jalapeños, cheese and sour cream. The best part... it had an egg on top of that! (i'm sold when it comes to anything with egg)

We also ordered the Breakfast bowl, which consisted of garlic fried rice, 2 eggs (made to your choice) and either longanisa or linguica sausage. We chose the longanisa sausage, which was very peppery, but not spicy peppery, but a good amount of spice. 

The chef was nice enough to give us a bread pudding on the house, which was very sweet of them. The bread pudding was not too sweet, and just perfect. 

The decor was nice, they had a mural of food trucks (i'm assuming this restaurant might have started out as a food truck, or is concurrently working as a food truck too) with dancing tacos, burgers and sausages.

The longanisa sausage was so good that we bought some to go, to take back to Los Angeles.

Overall, the food was good, service was excellent, and decor was clean and a pretty cool place to watch sports and chill. Would definitely go back and try more of their food.

Man this place has GOOD food and it's pretty cheap! Definitely will eat here again next time we're in vegas!! Was super surprised when we pulled up at 11 am on a Saturday to an empty parking lot. It's kind of a weird location not close to the strip but TOTALLY worth the trip!!

Definitely eat here. I consider myself to be a breakfast connoisseur -- it's the one thing I'm super passionate about in every variation. We had impeccable service and the menu was stellar. Between the friends I was dining with, we tried a bit of everything: chorizo fries, sausage rolls, chorizo hash, chorizo burrito, and the peachy french toast. The FT was made with Challah, topped with peach compote & fresh whipped cream -- just break my heart already! Compliments of the chef led us to pretzel bites and dessert and some very full bellies, in the best way. Whether you're feeling sweet or savory, this spot has you covered. Side note: their house-made chorizo is out of this world & so well-seasoned! Get it on everything you can.

Decent sausages, great service.  The dog and it's contents we're good.  Just wish I had a little more.  Quite honestly I think I could eat 1.5-2 dogs.  The fresh cut fries were excellent.  And the potato salad samples we got were awesome!

Pretty hidden place... Took a little while to find.

This place is a hidden gem! Dirt cheap prices (honestly they should charge more) for delicious food with decent portion sizes. Very friendly staff and clean, cute atmosphere. We were just visiting from out of town but we will definitely be back. His place has a bit of a weird, out of the way location, but it's worth it!
Food was great and service was excellent. I wanted to get everything off the menu, but settled with a Breakfast bowl and a hotdog. Good stuff.

We saw this restaurant a few weeks ago and decided to check it out tonight. The food was tasty at a great price and the service was good & friendly. We ordered the pretzel bites, chorizo quesadilla and the Smoky Robinson with a side of onion rings. All were great. We'll definitely be back, especially since I want to try some of the all day breakfast items

So glad we stumbled upon this place thanks to a small advertisement we ran into. The food is amazing.  I had the Smoky Robinson spicy sausage and my husband had a hamburger that involved 2 beef patties, cheese and some sausage as well. I was wondering how the heck we were going to eat this hamburger because it was HUGE, but we made it work! The best food we had the whole time visiting Vegas for a week.
Nice quiet spot. Food is good. Little expensive but I would come here again. Hot dogs are unique and good place for late night or a date.

Great food - great staff - great place in general! Definitely check this place out if you're hungry. We did not eat the rest of the day! The chorizo fries were SO good! Burger was a great size and the toasted brioche bun was to die for. Great place!
Great food, very friendly service.  If we lived here we would be back weekly!!  Hot wings were great, fries were hand cut.  Everyone enjoyed our food.

Super fantastic amazing!  Definitely recommend.  I loved that they had vegetarian options!  The veggie sausage breakfast burrito was great!  I sampled my kids waffle and French toast too, all wonderful!

We were a bit hesitant going in, but were pleasantly surprised. Good value for money, and if you're not into dawgs/sausages they have other things to pick from. Beer menu is legit. Server was very nice and helpful.

After several overpriced mediocre meals on the strip, this place was heaven. As soon  as we walked in the door we were made to feel at home. The Pulled pork Fries and chorizo has were OUTSTANDING. OMG!!!! And the prices were very reasonable....We are coming back tomorrow!

What a great find in an old strip mall close to the convention center. Everyone should try when in Vegas. Affordable restaurant close to the convention center. Good place to come for a quick lunch during a trade show.

Wow! This was an honest to god religious experience! The meal started off with a great (yes I know great is a word over used by our/your president-but fully deserved here) oatmeal draft stout beer with chocolate and coffee undertones. I ordered the onion rings which were wonderfully crunchy and tasty covered in panko bread crumbs.  

The decor is stylish, modern, clean and the bathrooms are spotless.  The service is friendly, quick and responsive no matter how many people are in the restaurant.

My main dish was the Fridge hamburger that had 2 beef patties, a house made brioche bun, sauerkraut, grilled onions, bacon, Swiss cheese, and topped with a grilled polish sausage. When it comes to your table it doesn't look as large as the pictures but it's so dense, rich, and flavorful you won't mind and probably won't finish it. I had reservations about sauerkraut with a burger but the sausage in combination with evecrything else make it a tangy, delicious wonder. I will be back!

This place is a must for really delicious food, a great selection of beers and an atmosphere of relaxed fun & conversation.  We felt like we were back in the best part of the midwest for great food, great folks and really fair prices.  We went here-our daughter's treat-for a Valentine dinner and to celebrate two family birthdays.  The service & staff was as wonderful as the food!!  The Chef, who has an amazing south bronx accent that is right out of the movies-gave us a delicious house specialty dessert to celebrate.  This was our first time here, but it certainly won't be the last.  Go enjoy the food, the light footprint on your wallet and the great atmosphere!!  Thanks Sausagefest!!

This place is so good! I went for breakfast but they offer lunch too. It's very reasonably priced and very worth every dime. Excellent service, good vibe and convenient location. It's just a couple block down east Sahara from the SLS.

Had dinner here last night with a couple friends. Food was great. Audi was our server and she was great! Happy hour was $1 off wine and beer and hot dog and fries for $5. The burgers are not $5 during happy hour however.

You ever been broke and put on a pair of pants and you looked inside the pocket and you found the 10 or $20 bill in them and you would like wow that  just made my day well that's how I came about finding sausagefest it is definitely a Vegas gem. Chef  Anthony Vidal as put together a fantastic concept.  It's located in a old strip mall right off Sahara. However, the restaurant is considered on Sahara. I was in the area and I decided to Yelp and find a burger spot and I wanted not an ordinary Burger but something that was extraordinary well that's exactly what I got at sausage fest. I ordered the fridge which has two Angus patties sauerkraut cheese and sausage to top it off. The burger was superb everything that you want in a burger real moist eat greedy taste of the Angus sauerkraut just right cheese gooey and melted all over. With a touch of Dijon sauce to top it off. So for those of you who are reading this post and you happen to be a visitor cuz I am on local guide and I'm always searching for local gems in Vegas and this is certainly one. Give yourself a break after you've had your fill of the strip go out this is definitely one of the places you need to visit it's a local place through and through enjoy not that far from the strip.

Oh my goodness, this place is so delicious. We ordered the Smokey Robinson, French Toast and Chorizo Hash and it was all so good. Oh and you must not forget about the onion rings. We will be coming here every time we are in Vegas. Also our server, Audi was super friendly and helpful!!!

New go-to place in Vegas! Upon arrival, the restaurant was pretty empty so we were immediately greeted by a friendly waitress. After we were seated, the waitress let us know that the chef was sending out some free appetizers for us! He sent out the sausage rolls and they were delicious! We also ordered Chorizo fries and they were out of this world! For our main course, we all ordered something different. Everything was awesome (especially The Fridge). We ordered the chocolate dessert waffle and it was also really good. Before we left, the chef came out and talked to us for a bit about the restaurant. Friendly staff and awesome food!!!
Try the house French toast!  It is delicious and not your everyday French toast it's made from challah bread and has candied walnuts.  Yummy!!  Service was great too hidden gem!

This is probably my TO GO spot from now on when I come to Vegas. Their food is amazing, I got the French toast and the green eggs and spam OMG DELICIOUS, the chef knows what he is doing. Clean restaurant and their staff is friendly. I highly recommended this restaurant.

Do yourself a favor and eat here. I forgot to take pictures of our food but I had the Milwaukee Brat and Panko Onion Rings. David had the Chorizo Burger and fresh cut fries. Very good food, nice service, a little quiet for a Friday night which I don't understand because it was really good.  Of course it's in Commercial Center but you have to put that aside in order to enjoy yourself. Once you're inside the restaurant you wouldn't know that your in commercial center.

Sausage Fest has provided me with some of the best customer experience I've received and the amazing food is just a plus. My wife (who was pregnant at the time)  and I went in one day to order some of their Vegan Dogs.  The waitress was very helpful and when she found out that my wife was pregnant she brought out a tray of pretzel bites free of charge(amazing). I would highly recommend Sausage Fest to anyone!

This a new place and is my go to spot before work!  first off the food is on point .. it is an open kitchen which makes the food so much tastier!! Very clean atmosphere and I would love to come here to watch some games on my days off~
Love this new Haunt commercial center great food fun atmosphere simple easy menu loaded with flavor I love the all-day breakfast and the variety of sausages even vegetarian and salads

We found this little gem hidden in commercial center. Even though it sounds like a very bad party, we thought we would give it a try I due to it's perfect yelp reviews.  

Simple food done with passion.  Great food and they treated us like we were food critics for Netflix or something.  

Chef was so enthusiastic, he kept sending out samples.  

The manager and chef have opened a ton of places and their experience showed.
